intro: Dryandra acanthopoda, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dryandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to Western Australia and is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant is typically found in heathlands and sandy soils, thriving in full sun. It has a woody structure with a single stem and produces distinctive, urn-shaped flowers that attract nectar-feeding birds and insects. Dryandra acanthopoda is a hardy plant that is well adapted to the arid and semi-arid environments of its native region.
